article.headline: Zoom offering hardware-as-a-service option
article.body: Zoom Video Communications Inc. ZM, +2.89% said Tuesday that it's partnering with several hardware makers to streamline its video communication services. Zoom said it launched a hardware-as-a-service option and partnered with hardware manufacturers DTEN, Neat, Poly, and Yealink to "minimize friction" around getting enterprise-grade hardware to run its Zoom Rooms and Zoom Phone services. Shares of Zoom were flat Tuesday, but are up 284% for the year as the video-conferencing company has become one of the biggest beneficiaries of the work-from-home trend resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic.
